Detailed Description

The Swarm class containing and controlling the individual birds.

The actions of the single birds are initiated from here and the information about the current best bird is kept here.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Swarm::Swarm ( PSO *  pso_p,
int  size,
int  dim,
double  min_x,
double  max_x,
double  min_v,
double  max_v,
int  nrScouts_in = 0 
)

Constructor for the swarm.

Parameters:
pso_p  The PSO Algorithm for the parameters used
size  The number of birds to create
dim  The dimension of the search space, i.e. the function to be optimized,
min_x  Lower bound of x dimension, x0 chosen randomly
max_x  Upper bound of x dimension, x0 chosen randomly
min_v  Lower bound of v dimension, v0 chosen randomly
max_v  Upper bound of v dimension, v0 chosen randomly
nrScouts_in  The number of additional scouts, default = 0

Here is the call graph for this function:

Reimplemented in PyramidSwarm.

Here is the call graph for this function:

int Swarm::step ( int  steps = 1  )  [virtual]

The swarm does steps steps.

Within one iteration the following actions are done for all the birds.
The current position is evaluated, the iteration best bird is determined and compared to the global best, the current velocity is adjusted to the global best bird and the birds are moved.

Reimplemented in PyramidSwarm, DynamicPyramidSwarm, AdaptivePyramidSwarm, RingSwarm, LocalSwarm, and ScoutSwarm.

Here is the call graph for this function:

Delete the particle with the given index.

Swarmsize is decreased

Bird * Swarm::evaluatePos (  )  [protected, virtual]

All the particles in the swarm evaluate their current position.

If the current position is better than the previous best, it is stored.

Returns:
The iteration best individual

Here is the call graph for this function:

void Swarm::compare ( Bird *  itrBestBird  )  [protected, virtual]

Compare iteration best particle to the global best and update.

If iteration best is better than globalBest it becomes the new globalBest individual.

Reimplemented in RingSwarm.

Here is the call graph for this function:

The velocity is updated according to the globalBestBird.

Reimplemented in PyramidSwarm, RingSwarm, LocalSwarm, and ScoutSwarm.

The iteration best scout

Here is the call graph for this function:

void Swarm::compareScouts ( Bird *  itrBestBird  )  [protected, virtual]

Compare iteration best scout to the currently best one and update.

If iteration best is better than globalBest it becomes the new globalBest scout, used for applyScout.

Here is the call graph for this function:

void Swarm::updateScoutVel (  )  [protected, virtual]

The velocity is updated according to a randomly chosen position.

As gbest attractor a randomly chosen within the search space is selected. The pbest value is still used.

Here is the call graph for this function:

void Swarm::moveScouts (  )  [protected, virtual]

All the scouts are moved.

Here is the call graph for this function:

void Swarm::randomizeBird ( Bird *  birdPtr,
const vector< double > &  bestVector,
bool  useBestPos 
) [protected]

The bird is re-randomized.

A new random position and random velocity is assigned

Parameters:
birdPtr The particle that is randomized
bestVector The space within which the particle is replaced can be moved
useBestPos Whether the new position is shifted about the best position

Here is the call graph for this function:

void Swarm::randomizeReset ( double  portion,
bool  reset 
) [protected]

A certain portion of the swarm is re-randomized.

The selected individuals are assigned a random position and a random velocity. Possibly the other individuals are reset.

Parameters:
portion The randomly chosen portion of the swarm that is re-randomized
reset The other individuals are reset (forget personal best)

Here is the call graph for this function:

void Swarm::applyScout ( bool  force = false  )  [protected, virtual]

If the best scout is better than the gbest individual it is reset.

The gbest particle is reset to the scout position and its best location is also updated.

Parameters:
force The reset to the best scout position is forced, even if it's worse than gbest

Here is the call graph for this function:

void Swarm::updateMeanPosition (  )  [protected]

Determine the current mean position of the swarm.

All the birds current positions are averaged

Determine the maximum distance between two birds.

void Swarm::calculateDiversity (  )  [protected, virtual]

Calculate the diversity.

The average and median distance to the swarm's mean position are calculated

bool Swarm::detectDynamicChange (  )  [protected, virtual]

Apply detection method for changed environment.

Depending on detectionMethod it is checked for a change in the evalutation function.

Returns:
True if the environment changed.

Reimplemented in DynamicPyramidSwarm.

void Swarm::updateBestValues (  )  [protected]

All individuals update their personal best position.

The personal best is invalidated by the change of the environment

scouts already up to date

Here is the call graph for this function:

bool Swarm::noisyBirdIsBetter ( Bird *  newBird,
Bird *  oldBird 
) [protected]

check whether the new position is better -- in the precense of noise

Considering a noisy function, the decision which position is better is based on the re-evaluation of the function value. In order to get a more precise estimate of the function values

Parameters:
newBird The new bird, sibling in HPSO
oldBird The old bird, predecessor in HPSO
Returns:
whether the new position is better

Here is the call graph for this function:
